trial_identification.studytitle: A Prospective Randomized Trial Comparing endoscopic LDRf and conventional Type(Japanese taxonomy) for endoscopic therapeutic esophagus variceal.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Prospective Randomized Trial Comparing Survival between endoscopic LDRf and Conventional Type(Japanese taxonomy) for endoscopic therapeutic esophagus variceal after EVS therapy.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: All patients in the intervention group recieve the endoscopy LDRf type to observe patients living rate after EVS therapy. Endoscopic variceal scleotherapy (EVS) was performed with 1% ethoxysclerol(4-10 ml each) 2 to 3 cm proximal to the gastroesophageal junction to eradicate the varices by intravariceal injection 20 minutes each once a week, until esophageal varicosis has disappeared. The LDRf type is considered to be an advanced endoscopic methods for GI variceal. LDRf type characterize it: L:Location;D:Diameter;Rf :Risk factor;The therapeutic method are decided by Location and Diameter; The therapeutic occasion is decided by Risk factor.Japanese type is a conventional type. Because LDRf type can decrease the risk after esophagus variceals therapy (e.g. rebleeding,mortality,degree of varices; etc).
interventions.comparator: EVS is given for this control group by the Japanese type; eradicate the varices by intravariceal injection each once a week, until esophageal varicosis has disappeared.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Complication rate. This outcome will be assessed through monitoring by health care professionals .
Survival rate :1 year after treatment. This outcom will be assessed by health care professionals through telephones or by letters.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: participants will be followed up once year after EVS ,EVS therapy by two kind of endoscopic type method(LDRf type and conventional type).

primaryOutcome.outcome: esophagus variceal remote recur by gastroscopy examination.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: esophagus variceal diferent rates of eradication assessed through monitoring by health care professionals .
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at 7 days ,1month,3moth,6month and 1 year after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The diferent rates of rebleeding of EV (esophagus variceal)assessed by health care professionals .
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at 72 hours,1month,3moth,6month and 1 year after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: average length of stay assessed by hospital records.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: esophagus variceal diagnosed by two kind of endoscopic type method (LDRf type and conventional type)simultaneity .
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1.remote recurrence by gastroscopy examination. 2. after treatment of EVS for EV repeated gastroscopy examination in the same patients.

trial_design.concealment: Each patient enrolled in the study will be given a serial number and will be randomized in blocks to one of the two groups: LDRf type and conventional type. Allocation is not concealed.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomization table created by a computer software

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Many articles have showed that LDRf is a safe and effective alternative type for endoscopic esophagus variceal. But there is still no one,which is prospectively randomized and controlled trial , So our purpose is to compare Survival between LDRf type and conventional type for endoscopic therapeutic esophagus variceal after EVS therapy.
